comments.text: As soon as you cross and walk a bit further into the town, you can ask all kinds of vehicles for a lift. There are plenty of taxis, though people are friendly and finding a free lift is more than possible.

If you plan hitchin' towards Thai border, one of the easiest options of getting out of Yangon city is taking a train to Bago. After you arrive there and get on the main road, you can start asking cars for a 10km lift to the crossroad.
The highway is running right through the center of the town. Plenty of space for trucks to stop along the road. It takes 15-45 minutes to get a ride north (to Lashio/Muse)
